abstract.text: Apply textures to the surface of your scene’s 3D objects to give each object a unique appearance.

inlineContent.text: Materials define the appearance of 3D models in RealityKit, by defining how their surfaces interact with light. Materials can also occlude objects behind them, hold shaders, or act as portals to view other worlds with
RealityKit includes a few material types to help you get started, including
for basic color and textures, and
for realistic lighting effects such as reflections, roughness, and emission.

abstract.text: The parameter type that custom materials uses for properties the
framework passes to shader functions.
Display virtual objects in your scene with mesh-based models.
An object that defines the clearcoat normal map texture.
An object that defines the intensity of an entity’s clear, shiny
coating.
The type used to represent opacity information.
Present videos in your RealityKit experiences.
An object that specifies an entity’s normal map.
Create a low-level texture and update its pixel data on the GPU to form a dynamic height and normal map.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Creating a dynamic height and normal map with low-level texture

abstract.text: The custom material’s optional shader function that can manipulate an
entity’s vertex data.
Synchronize the contents of entities locally or across the network.
An invisible material that hides objects rendered behind it.
An alias for the cull mode object that’s appropriate for this material class.
A container for texture data allowing you to create and update textures using your own format.
An object that represents the backing shader compilation required for
custom materials.
The type used to represent base color.
A set of types that material parameters can use.
An object that defines the specular highlights of an entity.
Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
The custom material’s surface shader function.

Use windows, volumes, and immersive spaces to teach people about the Earth.

A material that makes the mesh part a portal to a different world.
Control the lighting and point of view for a scene.
An object that defines the specular highlights of an entity.
An object that defines the color of the light an entity emits.
An alias for the triangle fill mode object that’s appropriate for this

An object used to define a material’s anisotropy angle.
Create personalized and realistic spatial audio experiences.
An alias for the cull mode object that’s appropriate for this material class.
An object that defines the reflectiveness of an entity.
The texture type to use for materials of this class.
Bring an iOS or iPadOS game to visionOS and enhance it.
